article.headline: Florida A&M 67, South Carolina St 60
article.story: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) -- Tony Tate scored 19 points, including nine in the final two minutes, to lead Florida A&M to a 67-60 comeback win over South Carolina State on Monday night. Trailing 58-57, Tate gave Florida A&M (5-10, 4-4 Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference) a brief lead with two free throws before South Carolina State regained the lead with its final points of the night. But Tate responded, hitting a 3-pointer with 1:19 left to give the Rattlers the lead for good. He sealed the win with four free throws as the Rattlers outscored South Carolina State (9-9, 3-5) 10-2 to end the game. Tate scored 15 of his 19 points in the second half. Michael Harper added 14 points for the Rattlers while Jonathan Kelly had 13. Shawn Wiggins led South Carolina State with 24 points, while Thurman Zimmerman added 15. The Bulldogs led most of the game until Tate hit a layup and a free throw with 10:19 left to give the Rattlers a 48-46 lead. The teams would trade the lead eight times down the stretch.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
